intro: Collinsia verna, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a delicate annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Collinsia verna plays an important role in early-season pollination by attracting bees and other pollinators.
